Description: Unaligned/unprocessed sequencing data
DependsOn: Component, SequencingLevel1_id, Filename, NGS Library Strategy, NGS Library Source, NGS Library Selection Method, NGS Library Layout, NGS Sequencing Platform, NGS Sequencing Design Description, NGS Library Preparation Kit Name, NGS Library Preparation Kit Vendor, NGS Library Preparation Kit Version, NGS Read Indicator, NGS Library Preparation Days from Index, NGS Sequencing Library Construction Days from Index, NGS End Bias, NGS Reverse Transcription Primer, NGS RIN, NGS DV200

Description: A unique identifier used by schematic for record updates and as a reference key in other schemas
Depth of coverage on assembly used. Found by (Unique Aligned Basecalls)/(Reference Length)
The average length of the sequencing reads. Can be integer, null
How nucleic acid molecules are isolated.
The assay associated with the nucleic acid library (e.g., RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq)
The type of source material being sequenced.
Text description of the library layout, one of Paired-end or Single.
Name of Library Preparation Kit. String
Vendor of Library Preparation Kit. String
Version of Library Preparation Kit. String
A platform is an object aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process [OBI_0000050]. Specific model of the sequencing instrument.
Valid Values: Illumina Next Seq 500, Illumina Next Seq 550, Illumina Next Seq 2500, Illumina NovaSeq 6000, Illumina MiSeq, 454 GS FLX Titanium, AB SOLiD 4, AB SOLiD 2, AB SOLiD 3, Complete Genomics, Illumina HiSeq X Ten, Illumina HiSeq X Five, Illumina Genome Analyzer II, Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx, Illumina HiSeq 2000, Illumina HiSeq 2500, Illumina HiSeq 4000, Illumina MiSeq, Illumina NextSeq, Ion Torrent PGM, Ion Torrent Proton, Ion Torrent S5, PacBio RS, NovaSeq 6000, NovaSeqS4, Ultima Genomics UG100, Oxford Nanopore minION, GridION, PromethION, PacBio Sequel2, Revio, Illumina NextSeq 1000, Illumina NextSeq 2000, Other, unknown, Not Reported

Description: Free-form description of the methods used to create the sequencing library; a brief 'materials and methods' section.
Indicate if this is Read 1 (R1), Read 2 (R2), Index Reads (I1), or Other

Attribute: NGS Library Preparation Days from Index
Description: Number of days between sample for assay was received in lab and the libraries were prepared for sequencing [number]. If not applicable please enter 'Not Applicable'

Attribute: NGS Sequencing Library Construction Days from Index
Description: Number of days between sample for assay was received in lab and day of sequencing library construction [number]. If not applicable please enter 'Not Applicable'
The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag/end or the full length transcript

An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase [SO_0000112]. The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. oligo-dT or random primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA
A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products. Number
Represents the percentage of RNA fragments that are >200 nucleotides in size. Number
